intro: Galium estebani var. leioclados, commonly known as the smooth bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, opposite leaves that are usually lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are typically white or pale green, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the spring and summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky slopes.
